section.title: Orientation
section.paragraph: The fastest way to find certain subjects is via the A-Z index.
An initial overview of the vehicle is provided in the "Image search".

section.title: Production of the vehicle
section.paragraph: At the time of production at the plant, the printed Owner's Manual is the most current resource. Due to updates after the editorial deadline, differences may exist between the printed Owner's Manual and the Integrated Owner's Manual in the vehicle.
Notes on updates can be found in the appendix of the printed Owner's Manual for the vehicle.

section.title: After a software update in the vehicle
section.paragraph: After a vehicle software update, such as via Remote Software Upgrade, the Integrated Owner's Manual for the vehicle will contain the latest information.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The contents of the Owner's Manual are available in various media formats. The following Owner's Manual media formats are available:

item.paragraph: Printed Owner's Manual.
Integrated Owner's Manual in the vehicle.

section.title: Printed Owner's Manual
section.paragraph: The printed Owner's Manual shows all standard, country-specific and optional equipment that is currently available, or may become available in the future, for specific models.

section.title: Integrated Owner's Manual in the vehicle
Principle
section.paragraph: The Integrated Owner's Manual shows all standard, country-specific and optional equipment that is currently available, or may become available in the future, for specific models. The Integrated Owner's Manual can be displayed on the Control Display.

paragraph.textref: "MENU"
"All apps"
"Owner's Manual"

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired method of accessing the contents.

section.title: Scrolling through the Owner's Manual
section.paragraph: Swipe up or down until the next or previous contents are displayed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The Integrated Owner's Manual can be accessed from any menu. Depending on the selected function, either the associated description or the main menu of the Integrated Owner's Manual will be displayed.

section.title: Selecting context help from a menu

action-step.paragraph: Press and hold the desired menu item.

paragraph.textref: "General help"

section.title: Selecting context help from a Check Control message
section.paragraph: Directly from the Check Control message on the control display:

paragraph.textref: "Owner's Manual"

section.title: BMW ALPINA Supplementary Owner's Manual
section.paragraph: The printed Supplementary Owner's Manual contains all features and explanations that differ from the BMW Owner's Manual.

section.title: Supplementary Owner's Manuals
section.paragraph: Also follow the Supplementary Owner's Manuals, which are included in addition to the onboard literature.

section.title: Service center
section.paragraph: An authorized service center will be glad to answer questions at any time.

section.title: Service center
section.paragraph: An authorized service center will be glad to answer questions at any time.

section.title: Internet
section.paragraph: Vehicle information and general information on BMW, for instance, on technology, are available on the Internet: www.bmw.com.
Vehicle information and general information on BMW,for instance, on technology, are available on the Internet: www.bmw.co.jp.
Vehicle information and general information on BMW,for instance, on technology, are available on the Internet: www.bmwusa.com.

section.title: BMW Driver’s Guide app
section.paragraph: The BMW Driver's Guide app shows all standard, country-specific and optional equipment that is currently available, or may become available in the future, for specific models. The app can be displayed on smartphones and tablets.

section.title: BMW Driver’s Guide Web
section.paragraph: The BMW Driver's Guide Web shows all standard, country-specific and optional equipment that is currently available, or may become available in the future, for specific models. The BMW Driver’s Guide Web can be displayed in any current browser.

entry.paragraph: Icon
Meaning

paragraph.textref: Precautions that must be followed in order to avoid the possibility of injury to yourself and to others as well as serious damage to the vehicle.
Precautions that must be followed in order to avoid the possibility of injury to yourself and to others as well as serious damage to the vehicle.
Measures that can be taken to help protect the environment.
Measures that can be taken to help protect the environment.
Texts in vehicle used to select individual functions.
Texts in vehicle used to select individual functions.
Verbal instructions to use with the voice activation system.
Verbal instructions to use with the voice activation system.
Responses generated by the voice activation system.
Responses generated by the voice activation system.

section.title: Action steps
section.paragraph: Action steps to be carried out are presented as a numbered list. These steps must be carried out in the order shown.

section.title: Bulletpoint lists
section.paragraph: Items or actions without strict order or alternative options are shown as a bulletpoint list.

item.paragraph: First possibility.
Second possibility.

paragraph.textref: This symbol on a vehicle component indicates that further information on the component is available in the Owner's Manual.
This symbol on a vehicle component indicates that further information on the component is available in the Owner's Manual.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: These icons found on parts of the vehicle indicate that incorrect use of high-voltage technology or of orange-colored high-voltage components poses a risk of life-threatening injury by electric shock.

section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This Owner's Manual shows all models and all standard, country-specific and optional equipment that is currently available, or may become available in the future, for specific models. Therefore, this Owner's Manual also describes and illustrates equipment, systems and functions that are not available in a vehicle, for example due to the following situations:

item.paragraph: Selected optional equipment
National-market version or national-market equipment
Options for later release and software update

section.paragraph: This also applies to safety-related functions and systems.

Before starting a journey, verify whether the described equipment or function is available in the vehicle. Information on whether a function is currently available in the vehicle and if or when the function can be installed in the vehicle can be obtained from an authorized service center or other qualified service center.
A claim for the availability of equipment, a system or a function in the vehicle cannot be derived based on the description in the Owner's Manual.
When using these functions and systems, the applicable laws and regulations must be observed.
For any equipment and models not described in this Owner's Manual, refer to the printed Owner's Manuals and, if applicable, the included Supplementary Owner's Manual.
On vehicles with right-hand steering, some of the operating elements are arranged differently than shown in this Owner's Manual.
The control elements are partly explained separately on the example of a left-hand drive vehicle. Note the marks in the case of a vehicle with right-hand steering.
Your BMW service center is happy to answer any questions that you may have about the features and options applicable to your vehicle.

section.title: Built date
section.paragraph: The build date of your vehicle is located on the door pillar of the driver's door.

The build date is defined as the calendar month and the calendar year in which the body shell and the power train subassemblies are conjoined and the vehicle is driven or moved from the production line.

section.title: Basic information
section.paragraph: The manufacturer of your vehicle pursues a policy of constant development to ensure that our vehicles continue to embody the highest quality and safety standards. In rare cases, therefore, the features described in this Owner's Manual may deviate from those in your vehicle.

section.title: For Australia/New Zealand: basic information
section.paragraph: When reading this Owner's Manual, please bear the following in mind: to ensure that our vehicles continue to embody the highest quality and safety standards, we pursue a policy of continuous, ongoing development. Because modifications in the design of both vehicles and accessories may be introduced at any time, your own vehicle's equipment may vary from that described in this Owner's Manual. For the same reason, it is also impossible to guarantee that all descriptions will be completely accurate in all respects.

We must therefore ask for your understanding of the fact that we are unable to recognize legal claims based on discrepancies between the data, illustrations and descriptions in this Owner's Manual and your own vehicle's equipment. Please also note that some of the optional equipment described in this Owner's Manual is not available on Australian models due to restrictions imposed by Australian Design Rules and other requirements.
If you have any questions, your service center or another qualified service center or repair shop will be glad to advise you.

section.title: Production of the vehicle
section.paragraph: At the time of production at the plant, the printed Owner's Manual is the most current resource. Due to updates after the editorial deadline, differences may exist between the printed Owner's Manual and the Integrated Owner's Manual in the vehicle.
Notes on updates can be found in the appendix of the printed Owner's Manual for the vehicle.

section.title: After a software update in the vehicle
section.paragraph: After a vehicle software update, such as via Remote Software Upgrade, the Integrated Owner's Manual for the vehicle will contain the latest information.

section.title: About the content of the instructions
section.paragraph: There is a possibility of equipment modifications, which, with respect to function and vehicle safety as well as quality retention, are within valid traffic and transport laws as well as associated regulations.
Due to modifications and optimizations on the vehicle body, its equipment or accessory parts, the vehicle does not necessarily match those that are described in the content of the instructions.

The specification of the vehicle contains speed specifications that exceed the statutory specified maximum speed. This information does not present a recommendation to drive at high speeds. In the interest of accident prevention, compliance with the statutory specified maximum speed is mandatory.

section.title: Intended use
section.paragraph: Heed the following when using the vehicle:

item.paragraph: Owner's Manual.
Information on the vehicle. Do not remove stickers.
Technical vehicle data.
The laws and safety standards applicable in the country, where the vehicle is driven.
The traffic, speed, and safety laws where the vehicle is driven.
Vehicle documents and statutory documents.

section.title: Warranty
section.paragraph: The vehicle is technically configured for the operating conditions and registration requirements applying in the country of first delivery, also known as homologation. If the vehicle is to be operated in a different country, it might be necessary to adapt the vehicle beforehand to potentially differing operating conditions and registration requirements. If the vehicle does not comply with the homologation requirements in a certain country, it is not possible to lodge warranty claims for the vehicle in that country. The warranty claims can also be invalidated if the electrical system has been modified, for instance, by control units, hardware or software that have been classified as unsuitable by the vehicle manufacturer. More information can be obtained from a service center.

Notice: in addition to the statutory warranty, the selling authorized BMW dealers or the selling BMW AG dealers in Germany are granting additional defined benefits with the purchase of new BMW vehicles within the framework of the BMW Warranty Booklet. More information: www.bmw.de/qualitaetsbrief.

Your vehicle is technically configured for the operating conditions and registration requirements applicable in the country of first delivery, also known as homologation. If your vehicle is to be operated in a different country it might be necessary to adapt your vehicle to potentially differing operating conditions and registration requirements. Noncompliance with homologation requirements in a certain country may affect warranty coverage. Please consult the New Vehicle Limited Warranty Booklet for further information on warranty matters.

section.title: Maintenance and repairs
section.paragraph: Advanced technology, for instance the use of modern materials and high-performance electronics, requires suitable maintenance and repair work.

The manufacturer of the vehicle therefore recommends entrusting the relevant work to a BMW service center. If a different repair shop is selected, BMW recommends selecting a workshop that performs the appropriate work such as maintenance and repair according to BMW specifications with properly trained personnel. In the Owner's Manual, such works are referred to as "another qualified service center or repair shop".
If work is not carried out properly, for instance maintenance and repair, there is a risk of subsequent damages and related safety risks.
Advanced technology, for instance the use of modern materials and high-performance electronics, requires suitable maintenance and repair work.

The manufacturer of the vehicle recommends that you entrust corresponding procedures to a BMW center. If you choose to use another service facility, BMW recommends use of a facility that performs work, e.g., maintenance and repair, according to BMW specifications with properly trained personnel, referred to in the Owner's Manual as "another qualified service center or repair shop".
If work is performed improperly, for instance maintenance and repair, there is a risk of subsequent damage and related safety risks.
Improperly performed work on the vehicle paintwork can lead to a failure or fault of components, e.g., the radar sensors, and thereby result in a safety hazard.

section.title: Parts and accessories
section.paragraph: BMW recommends using parts and accessories that are approved by BMW and are therefore suitable for this purpose.
The BMW service center is the right contact for genuine BMW parts and accessories, other products approved by BMW and related qualified advice.
BMW has tested these products for safety and suitability in relation to BMW vehicles.

BMW assumes product responsibility for genuine BMW parts and accessories. However, we cannot accept any responsibility whatsoever for parts and accessories that have not been specifically approved by BMW.

BMW cannot evaluate whether each individual third-party product can be used with BMW vehicles without presenting a safety hazard. This guarantee does not apply when country-specific government approval has been granted. Testing of this kind may fail to embrace the entire range of potential operating conditions to which components might be exposed on BMW vehicles. Such products could conceivably fail to comply with BMW's own stringent quality standards.

section.title: Type approval for a vehicle
section.paragraph: and uniform symbol for the circulation of a product on the market of the Eurasian Economic Union

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The uniform symbol for the product circulation certifies that the modes of transportation have passed all procedures for the evaluation (confirmation) of their conformity, as specified in the technical code of the Eurasian Economic Union, with the safety of means of transportation with wheels, and also confirms its conformity with the specified binding requirements.

section.paragraph: The type approval, for which the number is shown on or next to the manufacturer's nameplate, is the documentation for the confirmation of compliance of a mode of transportation with the requirements of the technical code.

section.title: Parts and accessories
section.paragraph: BMW recommends the use of parts and accessory products approved by BMW.
Approved parts and accessories and advice on their use and installation are available from a BMW center.
BMW parts and accessories have been tested by BMW for their safety and suitability in BMW vehicles.
BMW warrants genuine BMW parts and accessories.

BMW does not evaluate whether each individual product from another manufacturer can be used with BMW vehicles without presenting a safety hazard, even if a country-specific official approval was issued. BMW does not evaluate whether these products are suitable for BMW vehicles under all usage conditions.

section.title: California Proposition 65 Warning
section.paragraph: For vehicles sold in California, the law requires vehicle manufacturers to provide the following warning:

overview.overview-text: Engine exhaust and a wide variety of Automobile components and parts

warning.paragraph: Engine exhaust and a wide variety of Automobile components and parts, including components found in the interior furnishings in a vehicle, contain or emit chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects and reproductive harm. In addition, certain fluids contained in vehicles and certain products of component wear contain or emit chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm. Battery posts, terminals and related accessories contain lead and lead compounds. Batteries also contain other chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer. Wash your hands after handling. Used engine oil contains chemicals that have caused cancer in laboratory animals. Always protect your skin by washing thoroughly with soap and water. For more information go to www.P65Warnings.ca.gov/passenger-vehicle.

Operating, servicing and maintaining a passenger vehicle or off-highway motor vehicle can expose you to chemicals including engine exhaust, carbon monoxide, phthalates, and lead, which are known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm. To minimize exposure, avoid breathing exhaust, do not idle the engine except as necessary, service your vehicle in a well-ventilated area and wear gloves or wash your hands frequently when servicing your vehicle. For more information go to www.P65Warnings.ca.gov/passenger-vehicle.

Breathing Diesel Engine exhaust exposes you to chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm. For more information go to www.P65Warnings.ca.gov/diesel.

section.title: Service and warranty
section.paragraph: We recommend that you read this publication thoroughly. Your vehicle is covered by the following warranties:

item.paragraph: New Vehicle Limited Warranty.
Rust Perforation Limited Warranty.
Federal Emissions System Defect Warranty.
Federal Emissions Performance Warranty.
California Emission Control System Limited Warranty.

section.paragraph: Detailed information about these warranties is listed in the New Vehicle Limited Warranty Booklet.

Your vehicle has been specifically adapted and designed to meet the particular operating conditions and homologation requirements in your country and continental region in order to deliver the full driving pleasure while the vehicle is operated under those conditions. If you wish to operate your vehicle in another country or region, you may be required to adapt your vehicle to meet different prevailing operating conditions and homologation requirements. You should also be aware of any applicable warranty limitations or exclusions for such country or region. In such case, please contact Customer Relations for further information.

section.title: Maintenance
section.paragraph: Maintain the vehicle regularly to sustain the road safety, operational reliability and the New Vehicle Limited Warranty.
Specifications for maintenance measures:

item.paragraph: BMW maintenance system.
Maintenance.
Maintenance Booklet, available online and accessible via a QR code in the New Vehicle Limited Warranty Booklet.
Warranty and Service Guide Booklet for Canadian models.

section.paragraph: If the vehicle is not maintained or is improperly maintained, this could result in serious damage to the vehicle.
A failure to maintain your vehicle or improper maintenance may affect your warranty coverage. Please consult the New Vehicle Limited Warranty Booklet for further information on warranty matters.
Refer to section on engine oil change regarding recommended service intervals for oil changes.

section.title: Responsibility for data
section.paragraph: The manufacturer of the vehicle is, in accordance with the data protection guidelines and laws, responsible for the processing of personal data that is collected as part of the use of the vehicle or of web pages, customer support, online services and marketing campaigns.

section.title: Personal reference
section.paragraph: Each vehicle is marked with a unique vehicle identification number. Depending on the country, the vehicle owner can be identified with the vehicle identification number, license plate and corresponding authorities. In addition, there are other options to track data collected in the vehicle to the driver or vehicle owner, such as via the ConnectedDrive account that is used.

section.title: Data protection rights
section.paragraph: In accordance with valid data protection laws, vehicle users have certain rights toward the manufacturer of the vehicle or companies that collect or process personal data.
Vehicle users have a comprehensive right to information free of charge toward entities that store personal data for the vehicle user.
These entities may be:

item.paragraph: Manufacturer of the vehicle.
Qualified service center.
Repair shops.
Service providers.

section.paragraph: Vehicle users have the right to demand information about what personal data was stored, the purpose for which the data is used and the origin of the data. Proof of ownership or use is required to receive this information.
The right to information also includes information with regard to data that was transmitted to other companies or entities.

The web page of the manufacturer of the vehicle contains the respective applicable data protection notices. These data protection notes contain information about the right to deletion or correction of data. The manufacturer of the vehicle also provides his contact information and that of the data protection officer on the internet.
The vehicle owner can also have the stored data in the vehicle read out, for a fee where required, at an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
The vehicle data is read out via the statutorily required diagnostic sockets in the vehicle.

section.title: Data processing
section.paragraph: It may be necessary for the manufacturer of the vehicle to collect personal data to fulfill its responsibilities to the customer or legislators or to offer high-quality products and services.
For example, this includes:

item.paragraph: The fulfillment of the contractual obligation within the framework of sales, maintenance and repair of vehicles, such as sales process, maintenance.
The fulfillment of the contractual obligation for the provision of digital vehicle-related services, such as BMW ConnectedDrive.
The assurance of product quality, research and development for new products as well as the optimization of service processes.
The performance of sales, service and administrative processes, including branches and national sales companies.
Customer support, such as handling of contracts.
Promotional communication and market research based on personal consent.
The fulfillment of statutory obligations, such as pertaining to information on Technical Campaigns.
The processing of warranty claims that have been asserted.

section.title: Type of collected data
section.paragraph: Depending on the situation, the following personal data can be collected.

item.paragraph: Name, address, telephone number.
Email address.
Personal information provided by the customer, for instance date of birth, education, household size or professional situation.
Identification data, such as driver's license.
Customer number, contract number, booked online services.
Stored payment information, for instance credit card number.
Information on transactions.
Information on fraud cases or criminal acts.

section.title: Interests
section.paragraph: Information provided by the customer on areas of interest, for instance, preferred products, hobbies and other personal preferences.

section.title: Use of web pages and communication

item.paragraph: Information on how web pages are used and if notifications are opened or forwarded.
Account information on online services, customer and interested party portals.

section.title: Transaction and interaction data
section.paragraph: Information on purchases of products and services, interactions with customer support and participation in market research studies.

section.title: Use of apps and services of the vehicle manufacturer
section.paragraph: Information on the use of apps on mobile devices and online services.

section.title: Information on vehicle functions and settings
section.paragraph: Information on functions and settings of the vehicle, for instance for the use of online services.

section.title: Vehicle related sensor data and use data
section.paragraph: Data that is generated or processed in the vehicle.

item.paragraph: Driver assistance systems: processing of sensor data that is used to assess the vehicle’s surroundings or the behavior of the drivers.
Personal Profile: settings that are stored in the vehicle profile, for instance seat setting.
Multimedia, Navigation, for instance destinations.

section.title: Time of data collection
section.paragraph: The collection of personal data can occur at the following times:

item.paragraph: In case of direct contact with the manufacturer of the vehicle, for instance via the web page.
In case of requests for information on products and services or direct purchases, such as on web pages or from apps.
In case of direct purchases, for instance on the web page.
In case of direct purchases of services, for instance online services.
In case of a customer response to direct marketing campaigns, for instance when personal data is provided.
In case of the use of vehicles, products, services and digital offers, for instance web pages, apps.
For transmission of personal data by qualified partners of the manufacturer of the vehicle or by third-party providers, provided the prerequisites of the data protection laws are met.
In case of provision of personal data by certified address providers, provided the prerequisites of the data protection laws are met.
In case of reading out vehicle data, including vehicle identification number, during service, maintenance and repair services.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Electronic control devices are installed in the vehicle. Electronic control units process data they, for instance, receive from vehicle sensors, self-generate or exchange with each other. A large number of the control units are necessary for the safe functioning of the vehicle or to assist while driving, e.g., the driver assistance systems. Furthermore, control units facilitate comfort or infotainment functions.

Data stored in the vehicle can be deleted at any time. This data is only transmitted to third parties upon personal request as part of the use of online services. The transmission depends on the selected settings for the use of the services.

section.title: Sensor data
section.paragraph: Driver assistance systems, for instance, Active Cruise Control, Collision Warning or Fatigue Assistant, process sensor data that is used to evaluate the vehicle’s surroundings and, if applicable, the behavior of the driver.
For example, this includes:

item.paragraph: Status messages for the vehicle and its individual components, e.g., wheel RPM, wheel speed, deceleration, lateral acceleration, engaged seat belts.
Ambient conditions, e.g., temperature, rain sensor signals.

section.paragraph: The data is only processed in the vehicle and generally volatile. It will only be stored beyond the operating period if this is required for the fulfillment of the services that were agreed to with the customer.

section.title: Electronic components
section.paragraph: Electronic components, e.g. control units and vehicle keys, contain components for storing technical information. Information about the vehicle condition, component usage, maintenance recommendations, events or faults can be stored temporarily or permanently.
This information generally documents the state of a component, a module, a system, or the vehicle’s surroundings, for instance:

item.paragraph: Operating states of system components, such as fill levels, tire pressure, battery status.
Malfunctions and faults in important system components, for instance lights and brakes.
Responses by the vehicle to special driving situations such as airbag deployment or engagement of the driving stability control systems.
Information on vehicle-damaging events.

section.paragraph: The data is required to perform the control unit functions. Furthermore, it also serves to recognize and correct malfunctions, and helps to optimize vehicle functions.
The majority of this data is stored temporarily and is only processed within the vehicle itself. In some circumstances the vehicle may store some data for an additional but limited period of time.

section.title: Personal settings
section.paragraph: Comfort functions, for instance seat, climate or light settings, make each trip even more pleasant. The personal settings of this function can be stored in a BMW ID or in a profile in the vehicle and can be accessed on request, for instance when the settings were changed by another driver in the interim. Depending on the vehicle equipment, these profiles can be stored in secure data systems of the manufacturer of the vehicle. In case of a vehicle change, these stored profiles can simply be transferred to another vehicle.
The vehicle settings stored in a BMW ID or vehicle profile can be changed or deleted at any time.

section.title: Multimedia and navigation
section.paragraph: In addition, data can be transferred to the entertainment and communication system of the vehicle, for instance via smartphone. The entered data can be processed in the vehicle, for instance to play personal play lists.
This includes the following depending on the respective equipment:

item.paragraph: Multimedia data such as music or photos for playback in an integrated multimedia system.
Address book data for use in conjunction with an integrated hands-free system or an integrated navigation system.
Destinations: depending on the equipment, destinations that were taught into the navigation system are used to start guidance automatically.
Data on the use of Internet services.

section.paragraph: This data can be stored locally in the vehicle or is located on a device that has been connected to the vehicle, e.g., a smartphone, or USB stick.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: When servicing, for instance during repairs, service processes, warranty cases, and quality assurance measures, this technical information can be read out from the vehicle together with the vehicle identification number.

section.title: Stored data
section.paragraph: Electronic components of the vehicle may contain a data memory that stores technical information on the vehicle condition, events and faults. The data required for the service activity is processed locally and automatically deleted after the work is finished. An authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop can read out the information. As part of service or repair orders, the data is read out via the diagnostic socket with special diagnostic systems and transmitted to the manufacturer of the vehicle. An objection to the reading out and forwarding of data is possible.

section.title: Optimizing service processes
section.paragraph: The manufacturer of the vehicle maintains the documentation for the respective vehicle to ensure optimal service. Within the framework of government regulations, this documentation may be provided to an authorized third party, for instance repair shops.

Independent operators must use this data exclusively as intended for the completion of the respective service or repair order. This prevents, for instance, that duplicate work is performed on the vehicle.

section.title: Assurance of product quality
section.paragraph: The data documents technical conditions of the vehicle, which can be used to determine vehicle maintenance status, and facilitate quality improvement.

For the assurance of product quality and the development of new products, data can be read out for the use of individual components and systems, for instance light, brake, power window, displays. This data helps the manufacturer of the vehicle with the optimization of the design of components and systems. The analysis of the data is also the basis for Technical Campaigns and statutorily required recalls.
Furthermore, the manufacturer has to meet his product monitoring duty in line with product liability law. To fulfill these duties, the vehicle manufacturer needs technical data from the vehicle.

section.title: Goodwill and warranty claims
section.paragraph: The data from the vehicle can also be used to check customer claims for warranty and guaranty. In the case of asserted goodwill or warranty claims, the read out data is transmitted to the manufacturer of the vehicle for the expedient determination of the claims.
Fault and event memories in the vehicle can be reset when an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop performs repair or servicing work.

section.title: Control of the data
section.paragraph: Data transfers to the manufacturer of the vehicle for the purpose of ensuring the product quality and optimization of the service processes may be prevented upon request.

section.title: Statutory requirements for the disclosure of data
section.paragraph: The manufacturer of the vehicle is obligated to provide data he has stored to the authorities within the framework of the applicable laws. This provision of data to the required extent occurs in individual cases, such as to investigate a crime.

Public authorities are authorized to read out the data from the vehicle themselves in accordance with the applicable laws. Information can be read out from the airbag control unit, e.g., to investigate an accident, among other things.

In line with legal obligations within the EU, specific consumption data of the vehicle, known as OBFCM data, is passed on the to EU Commission by the vehicle manufacturer, e.g. fuel and energy consumption and distance traveled. The vehicle owner can refuse to provide this data for this purpose.

section.title: Mobile devices
section.paragraph: Depending on vehicle equipment, mobile devices like smartphones can be connected to the vehicle and then used to control vehicle functions, e.g., Apple CarPlay. The sound and picture from the mobile devices can be played back and displayed in the vehicle through the multimedia system.

Selected information is transferred to the mobile devices at the same time. Depending on the type of incorporation, this includes, for instance, position data and other general vehicle information. This optimizes the way in which selected apps, for instance navigation or music playback, work. How the data will be processed further is determined by the provider of the particular app being used.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: If the vehicle has a wireless network connection, the exchange of data between the vehicle and other systems is possible, e.g., with BMW ConnectedDrive.

section.title: Services from the vehicle manufacturer
section.paragraph: Where online services from the vehicle manufacturer are concerned, the corresponding functions are described in the appropriate place, for instance the Owner's Manual or manufacturer's web page. The relevant legal information pertaining to data protection may also be found on the manufacturer’s website.
Personal data may be used to perform online services. Data is exchanged over a secure connection, for instance with the data systems of the vehicle manufacturer intended for this purpose.
Any collection, processing, and use of personal data above and beyond that needed to provide the services must always be based on a legal permission, contractual arrangement or consent by the user.

section.title: BMW ConnectedDrive
section.paragraph: BMW ConnectedDrive networks the vehicle with a large number of digital services. In case of use, only data stored in the vehicle that is required for the completion of the agreed service, for instance information for identification and localization of the vehicle, will be transmitted online. The basis is the contractual agreement with the user.

In individual cases, the transmission of data is triggered by predefined events, for instance the intelligent emergency call. The wireless network connection is realized via an in-vehicle transmitter and receiver unit or via personal mobile devices brought into the vehicle, for instance smartphones. The data transfer can be deactivated on request.
The wireless network connection facilitates the use of online functions. These include online services and apps supplied by the vehicle manufacturer or by other providers.

section.title: Services from other providers
section.paragraph: When using online services from other providers, these services are the responsibility of the relevant provider and subject to their data privacy conditions and terms of use. The manufacturer of the vehicle has no influence on data exchanged in this process.
Information on the way in which personal data is collected and used in relation to services from third parties, the scope of such data, and its purpose, can be obtained from the relevant provider.

section.title: Personal decision
section.paragraph: Each user decides for himself if an agreement for the service is entered, for instance for BMW ConnectedDrive. Written information on the scope and content of data processing is provided prior to purchasing the service and part of the vehicle handover.

The user has the option to have the services deactivated at any time and thereby disallow the data processing that is necessary for these services. It is also possible to activate or deactivate the data connection as a whole. This excludes functions and services required by law such as Assist systems.

section.title: Transparency of vehicle data
section.paragraph: BMW CarData provides transparency in handling vehicle data with the use of BMW ConnectedDrive. BMW CarData can be used to control if vehicle data that is processed in the context of BMW ConnectedDrive will be transmitted to third parties. A decision can thereby be made for each individual service offering whether data release for third parties should be granted or rejected, for instance for insurance companies.

Furthermore, an archive can be requested from BMW CarData at any time. The archive provides information on data that was sent and stored as part of BMW ConnectedDrive. Access to BMW CarData by third-party providers is exclusively facilitated via the server of the manufacturer of the vehicle. Direct access to the vehicle and its data will not be permitted.
More information on BMW CarData is available in the BMW ConnectedDrive customer portal.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The eCall Assist system required by law enables manual Emergency Requests or Automatic Collision Notifications to be issued in the event of accidents, for instance.
Required by law, the Call Assist system is used to manually call for assistance and also makes automatic emergency calls in the event of an accident, for instance.
The emergency requests are received by the public rescue coordination center.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Information about the 112 Emergency Call based onboard statutory eCall Assist system, its operation and its functions are located in Chapter Emergency Request.
The 112 Emergency Call based eCall service is a public service of general interest and available free of charge.

In the event of a major accident, the statutory Call Assist system is automatically activated by onboard sensors by default. Furthermore, it is triggered automatically when the vehicle is equipped with an intelligent Assist system, which is inoperable in the event of a major accident.
The statutory Call Assist system can also be activated manually as required.
In the event of a critical system failure that would disable the statutory Call Assist system, the passengers are given a warning.
Additional information:

item.paragraph: Emergency call.
Malfunction.

section.title: Information about data processing
section.paragraph: The processing of personal data via the statutory eCall Assist system is in compliance with the following regulations:

item.paragraph: Protection of personal data: Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and Council.
Protection of personal data: Directive 2002/58/EC of the European Parliament and Council.

section.paragraph: The processing of personal data is limited to the purpose of transmitting the eCall emergency requests to the uniform European Emergency Call number 112.

section.title: SIM card
section.paragraph: The statutory Call Assist system operates via wireless transmission through the SIM card installed in the vehicle. The SIM card is not permanently connected to the mobile phone network; rather, it remains connected only as long as the emergency call is active.

section.title: Data types and their recipients
section.paragraph: The statutory Call Assist system can only collect and process the following data:

item.paragraph: The vehicle identification number for the rapid identification of the vehicle, such as the model.
Vehicle type, e.g. passenger car.
Type of vehicle drive, for estimating risks during salvage, e.g., fire hazard.

The position of the vehicle at the time of the accident and the last three current locations of the vehicle and driving direction, for example, to locate the vehicle faster in more complex route sections.
Log file of the automatic activation of the system and its time stamp.
Control information, which tells rescue forces whether the emergency call was triggered automatically or manually, for instance.
A time stamp for determining the time of the accident in order to optimize rescue forces' deployment plans.
The driving direction, for example to locate information about the side of the road on freeways.

section.paragraph: The authorities of the state in which the emergency request of the eCall system occurs specify the emergency call centers where the data of the statutory emergency request is received and processed.

section.title: Organization of data processing
section.paragraph: The statutory Call Assist system ensures that the data stored in system memory is only accessible outside of the system after an emergency request is triggered.
The data collected for the statutory Call Assist system is only stored in the vehicle and sent to the rescue coordination center when an emergency request is triggered.
The statutory Call Assist system ensures that it cannot be traced and that no continuous tracking occurs during normal operation.
The statutory Call Assist system ensures that the data in the system's internal memory is deleted automatically and continuously.

The data for the current location of the vehicle is continuously overwritten in the internal memory of the system to ensure that no more than the last three required current locations of the vehicle are available for the normal operation of the system.

The report of the activity data of the statutory eCall Assist system is stored no longer than it is required to fulfill the handling of the eCall emergency request and under no circumstances longer than 13 hours from the time at which an eCall emergency call was triggered.

section.title: Rights of persons affected by data processing
section.paragraph: A person who is affected by the data processing, e.g., the vehicle owner, has the right to access the data and can, where applicable, demand the correction, deletion or locking of data that applies to him or her and that is not processed in compliance with statutory regulations. Every correction, deletion or locking carried out according to these regulations must be communicated to the third parties to whom the data is transmitted to the extent that this is possible with reasonable effort.

The person who is affected by the data processing has the right to file a complaint at the appropriate data protection authority if he or she feels that the processing of his or her personal data has violated his or her rights.
The point of contact for processing access rights is an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The intelligent Assist system enables manual or Automatic Collision Notifications to be issued in the event of accidents, for instance.
The emergency requests are received by a emergency call center that was appointed by the manufacturer of the vehicle.
In addition to the Intelligent Call Assist system, the vehicle also has the statutory Call Assist system that activates depending on the situation.
The vehicle owner has the right to choose whether to use the Intelligent Call Assist system or the statutory Call Assist system.
Additional information:
Emergency call.

section.title: Legal basis
section.paragraph: The processing of personal data via the intelligent Assist system is in compliance with the following regulations:

item.paragraph: Protection of personal data: Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and Council.
Protection of personal data: Directive 2002/58/EC of the European Parliament and Council.
Act on the protection of personal data of the People's Republic of China.
Data protection act of the People's Republic of China.

section.paragraph: The ConnectedDrive contract concluded for this function as well as the relevant laws, ordinances and guidelines of the European Parliament and the European Council provide the legal basis for the activation and function of the intelligent Assist system.
The corresponding ordinances and guidelines govern the protection of individuals in terms of processing personal data.
The processing of personal data through the intelligent Assist system is in compliance with the European guidelines for the protection of personal data.
The ConnectedDrive contract concluded for this function forms the legal basis for the activation and function of the intelligent Assist system.
The corresponding ordinances and guidelines govern the protection of individuals in terms of processing personal data.
The intelligent Assist system processes personal data in compliance with the law of the People’s Republic of China on the protection of personal data.
The intelligent Assist system only processes personal data with the consent of the vehicle owner.

The intelligent Assist system and other services with additional uses can only process personal data based on the explicit consent from the persons who are affected by the data processing, e.g., vehicle owners.

section.title: SIM card
section.paragraph: The intelligent Assist system operates via wireless transmission through the SIM card installed in the vehicle. The SIM card is permanently logged into a mobile phone network so a connection can be set up quickly. The data is sent to the manufacturer of the vehicle in the event of an emergency.

section.title: Improving quality
section.paragraph: The vehicle manufacturer also uses the data transmitted as part of an emergency call to improve product and service quality.

section.title: Position determination
section.paragraph: Only the provider of the mobile phone network is able to determine the position of the vehicle based on cell tower locations. The call operator is not able to link the vehicle identification number to the phone number of the installed SIM card. Only the vehicle manufacturer is able to link the vehicle identification number to the phone number of the installed SIM card.

section.title: Log data for Emergency Requests
section.paragraph: The log data for Emergency Requests is stored in a vehicle memory. The oldest log data is regularly deleted. The log data includes information on when and where an emergency call was issued, for instance.

In exceptional cases, the log data can be read out from the vehicle memory. It is usually only possible for log data to be read out with a court order and if the corresponding devices are connected to the vehicle directly.

section.title: Automatic emergency call
section.paragraph: The system is designed so that it will automatically trigger an emergency call if the sensors in the vehicle detect an accident of corresponding severity.

section.title: Transmitted information
section.paragraph: Sending an emergency call with the Intelligent Call Assist system forwards the same information to the appointed emergency call center as the information that is sent to the public rescue coordination center when using the statutory Call Assist system.

In addition, the intelligent Assist system transmits the following information to a emergency call center that is appointed by the manufacturer of the vehicle and the public rescue coordination center, where applicable:
The intelligent Assist system sends information to an emergency call center appointed by the vehicle manufacturer and passes it on to the public rescue coordination center, where applicable:

item.paragraph: Accident data, for instance the direction of the collision as detected by the vehicle sensors to simplify the rescue forces' deployment plans.

Contact information, for instance the phone number of the installed SIM card and the driver's phone number, if available, to make it possible to contact the parties involved in the accident quickly, where applicable.

section.title: Data storage
section.paragraph: The data relating to an emergency call that has been placed is stored in the vehicle. The data contains information about the emergency call, such as the place and time it was issued.
The emergency call center stores audio recordings of the Emergency Request conversation.

Audio recordings of the customer are stored for 24 hours, in case details of the Emergency Request need to be analyzed. After that, the audio recordings are deleted. Audio recordings of the emergency call center employee are stored for 24 hours for quality assurance purposes.

section.title: Disclosure of personal data
section.paragraph: The data obtained in the context of an intelligent emergency call is only used to process the Emergency Request. If legally obliged to do so, the vehicle manufacturer will disclose the data it has processed and, where applicable, still has stored.

section.title: Statutory Assist system
section.paragraph: The owner of a vehicle that is equipped with an Intelligent Call Assist system and the statutory Call Assist system has the right to use the onboard Call Assist system instead of the Intelligent Call Assist system.
The point of contact for deactivation requests is an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

The statutory Call Assist system is always on standby in addition to the Intelligent Call Assist system. The statutory Call Assist system takes over the emergency call function if the Intelligent Call Assist system is not capable of operating for technical reasons; for instance, if the emergency call center appointed by the vehicle manufacturer cannot be reached.
The statutory eCall Assist system uses the infrastructure of the 112 public emergency call number.

The system can be set up so that emergency calls are always made via the statutory Call Assist system and not the Intelligent Call Assist system. Have adjustment work performed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Electronic control devices are installed in the vehicle. Electronic control units process data they receive from vehicle sensors, self-generate or exchange with each other. Some control units are necessary for the vehicle to function safely or provide assistance during driving, for instance driver assistance systems. Furthermore, control units facilitate comfort or infotainment functions.
Information about stored or exchanged data can be requested from the manufacturer of the vehicle, in a separate booklet, for example.

section.title: Personal reference
section.paragraph: Each vehicle is marked with a unique vehicle identification number. Depending on the country, the vehicle owner can be identified with the vehicle identification number, license plate and corresponding authorities. In addition, there are other options to track data collected in the vehicle to the driver or vehicle owner, such as via the ConnectedDrive account that is used.

section.title: Data protection rights
section.paragraph: In accordance with valid data protection laws, vehicle users have certain rights toward the manufacturer of the vehicle or companies that collect or process personal data.
Vehicle users have a comprehensive right to information free of charge toward entities that store personal data for the vehicle user.
These entities may be:

item.paragraph: Manufacturer of the vehicle.
Qualified service center.
Repair shops.
Service providers.

section.paragraph: Vehicle users have the right to demand information about what personal data was stored, the purpose for which the data is used and the origin of the data. Proof of ownership or use is required to receive this information.
The right to information also includes information with regard to data that was transmitted to other companies or entities.

The web page of the manufacturer of the vehicle contains the respective applicable data protection notices. These data protection notes contain information about the right to deletion or correction of data. The manufacturer of the vehicle also provides his contact information and that of the data protection officer on the internet.
The vehicle owner can also have the stored data in the vehicle read out, for a fee where required, at an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
The vehicle data is read out via the statutorily required diagnostic sockets in the vehicle.

section.title: Statutory requirements for the disclosure of data
section.paragraph: The manufacturer of the vehicle is obligated to provide data he has stored to the authorities within the framework of the applicable laws. This provision of data to the required extent occurs in individual cases, such as to investigate a crime.

Public authorities are authorized to read out the data from the vehicle themselves in accordance with the applicable laws. Information can be read out from the airbag control unit, e.g., to investigate an accident, among other things.

In line with legal obligations within the EU, specific consumption data of the vehicle, known as OBFCM data, is passed on the to EU Commission by the vehicle manufacturer, e.g. fuel and energy consumption and distance traveled. The vehicle owner can refuse to provide this data for this purpose.

section.title: Operating data in the vehicle
section.paragraph: Control units process data to operate the vehicle.
For example, this includes:

item.paragraph: Status messages for the vehicle and its individual components, e.g., wheel RPM, wheel speed, deceleration, lateral acceleration, engaged seat belt indicator.
Ambient conditions, e.g., temperature, rain sensor signals.

section.paragraph: The processed data is only processed in the vehicle itself and is generally volatile. The data is not stored beyond the operating period.

Electronic components, e.g. control units and vehicle keys, contain components for storing technical information. Information about the vehicle condition, component usage, maintenance recommendations, events or faults can be stored temporarily or permanently.
This information generally documents the state of a component, a module, a system, or the surrounding area, for instance:

item.paragraph: Operating states of system components, such as fill levels, tire pressure, battery status.
Malfunctions and faults in important system components, for instance lights and brakes.
Responses by the vehicle to special driving situations such as airbag deployment or engagement of the driving stability control systems.
Information on vehicle-damaging events.

section.paragraph: The data is required to perform the control unit functions. Furthermore, it also serves to detect and correct malfunctions, and helps the vehicle manufacturer to optimize vehicle functions.
The majority of this data is stored temporarily and is only processed within the vehicle itself. In some circumstances the vehicle may store some data for an additional but limited period of time.

When servicing, for instance during repairs, service processes, warranty cases, and quality assurance measures, this technical information can be read out from the vehicle together with the vehicle identification number.
An authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop can read out the information. The diagnostic socket required by law in the vehicle is used to read out data.

The data is collected, processed, and used by the relevant organizations in the service network. The data documents technical conditions of the vehicle, which can be used to determine vehicle maintenance status, and facilitate quality improvement.

Furthermore, the manufacturer has product monitoring duties to meet in line with product liability law. To fulfill these duties, the vehicle manufacturer needs technical data from the vehicle. The data from the vehicle can also be used to check customer claims for warranty and guaranty.
Fault and event memories in the vehicle can be reset when an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop performs repair or servicing work.

section.title: Data entry and data transfer into the vehicle
General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the vehicle equipment, comfort and individual settings can be stored in the vehicle and modified or reset at any time.
For example, this includes:

item.paragraph: Settings for the seat and steering wheel positions.
Chassis and climate control settings.

section.paragraph: If necessary, data can be transferred to the entertainment and communication system of the vehicle, for instance via smartphone.
This includes the following depending on the respective equipment:

item.paragraph: Multimedia data such as music, films or photos for playback in an integrated multimedia system.
Address book data for use in conjunction with an integrated hands-free system or an integrated navigation system.
Entered navigation destinations.
Data on the use of Internet services.

section.paragraph: This data can be stored locally in the vehicle or is found on a device that has been connected to the vehicle, e.g., a smartphone, USB stick or MP3 player. If this data is stored in the vehicle, it can be deleted at any time.
This data is only transmitted to third parties upon personal request as part of the use of online services. The transmission depends on the selected settings for the use of the services.

section.title: Incorporation of mobile devices
section.paragraph: Depending on the vehicle equipment, mobile devices connected to the vehicle, for instance smartphones, can be controlled via the vehicle control elements.

The sound and picture from the mobile devices can be played back and displayed through the multimedia system. Certain information is transferred to the mobile devices at the same time. Depending on the type of incorporation, this includes, for instance, position data and other general vehicle information. This optimizes the way in which selected apps, for instance navigation or music playback, work.
There is no further interaction between the mobile device and the vehicle, such as active access to vehicle data.

How the data will be processed further is determined by the provider of the particular app being used. The extent of the possible settings depends on the respective app and the operating system of the mobile device.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: If the vehicle has a wireless network connection, it will enable data to be exchanged between the vehicle and other systems. The wireless network connection is realized via an in-vehicle transmitter and receiver unit or via personal mobile devices brought into the vehicle, for instance smartphones. This wireless network connection enables 'online functions' to be used. These include online services and apps supplied by the vehicle manufacturer or by other providers.

section.title: Services from the vehicle manufacturer
section.paragraph: Where online services from the vehicle manufacturer are concerned, the corresponding functions are described in the appropriate place, for instance the Owner's Manual or manufacturer's web page. The relevant legal information pertaining to data protection may also be found on the manufacturer’s website. Personal data may be used to perform online services. Data is exchanged over a secure connection, for instance with the IT systems of the vehicle manufacturer intended for this purpose.

Any collection, processing, and use of personal data above and beyond that needed to provide the services must always be based on a legal permission, contractual arrangement or consent. It is also possible to activate or deactivate the data connection as a whole. This excludes functions and services required by law such as Assist systems.

section.title: Services from other providers
section.paragraph: When using online services from other providers, these services are the responsibility of the relevant provider and subject to their data privacy conditions and terms of use. The vehicle manufacturer has no influence on the content exchanged during this process. Information on the way in which personal data is collected and used in relation to services from third parties, the scope of such data, and its purpose, can be obtained from the relevant service provider.

section.title: Event data recorder EDR
section.paragraph: This vehicle is equipped with an event data recorder (EDR). The main purpose of an EDR is to record, in certain crash or near crash-like situations, such as airbag deployment or collision with a road obstacle, data that will assist in understanding how a vehicle's systems performed. The EDR is designed to record data related to the driving dynamics and safety systems for a short period of time, typically 30 seconds or less.
The EDR in this vehicle is designed to record such data as:

item.paragraph: The operating characteristics of various vehicle systems.
Whether or not the driver and front passenger seat belts were fastened.
How far, if at all, the driver was depressing the accelerator and/or brake pedal.
How fast the vehicle was traveling.

section.paragraph: This data can help provide a better understanding of the circumstances, in which crashes and injuries occur.

EDR data is recorded by your vehicle only if a nontrivial crash situation occurs; no data is recorded by the EDR under normal driving conditions and no personal data, for instance name, gender, age, and crash location, are recorded.
However, other parties, such as law enforcement, could combine the EDR data with the type of personally identifying data routinely acquired during a crash investigation.

To read data recorded by an EDR, special equipment is required, and access to the vehicle or the EDR is needed. In addition to the vehicle manufacturer, other parties, such as law enforcement, that have the special equipment, can read out the information if they have access to the vehicle or the EDR.

section.title: General purpose and data retrieval
section.paragraph: This vehicle is equipped with an event data recorder (EDR).

Physical access to the vehicle or direct access to the electromotive throttle controller is required to read out the data recorded by the electromotive throttle controller. The electromotive throttle controller is located in the airbag control unit (Advanced Crash and Safety Module, ACSM).
The following options are available to retrieve the data of the throttle controller:

item.paragraph: Connection using the standardized OBD on-board diagnostics. In this case, data is provided via a standardized data retrieval protocol.

If access via OBD is not possible, for example if the vehicle is severely damaged, locate the electromotive throttle controller (Advanced Crash and Safety Module, ACSM) and attempt to read the data directly from the electromotive throttle controller using an adapter included with the CDR products.
This is possible while the electromotive throttle controller is still installed in the vehicle.
Alternatively, the electromotive throttle controller can be removed from the vehicle.

section.paragraph: In this case, special equipment, such as connectors and adapters, is required to establish a connection to the electromotive throttle controller. Bosch Diagnostic offers the equipment for the data retrieval (CDR, Crash Data Retrieval tool). More information is available on the Internet:
https://cdr.boschdiagnostics.com/cdr/.

section.title: Recorded accident events
section.paragraph: The recorded events can be front, side, rear end, active pedestrian protection or rollover events.

Front, side and rear end event data can be recorded as either deployment events (with airbag deployment) or non-deployment events (without airbag deployment). Both types of event can contain PreCrash and Crash data.
The electromotive throttle controller (in the Advanced Crash and Safety Module, ACSM) stores up to six events.
The electromotive throttle controller (in the Advanced Crash and Safety Module, ACSM) stores up to five events.

item.paragraph: Recorded events can be classified as unlocked in the memory.
An event is recorded when a change in the longitudinal or transverse speed exceeds 8 km/h in a time span of 150 ms. The event can be overwritten by any event.
An event is recorded when active pedestrian protection systems are activated. The event can be overwritten by deployment events.
The event is recorded when reversible rollover systems are activated. The event can be overwritten by deployment events.
Recorded events can be classified as disabled in memory.
The event cannot be overwritten by other events.
An event is recorded when any type of non-reversible restraint system is triggered.
The event is recorded when a change in the longitudinal or transverse speed exceeds 25 km/h in a time span of 150 ms.

section.title: Data elements

entry.paragraph: Name
Meaning
Acceleration in longitudinal direction.
Acceleration in longitudinal direction (X-axis).
Delta-V in longitudinal direction.
Change in the longitudinal speed of the vehicle. Delta-V in the longitudinal direction is only the longitudinal component of the entire delta-V.
Max. recorded Delta-V in longitudinal direction.
The maximum value of the cumulative change in vehicle speed along the X-axis, as recorded by the electromotive throttle controller.
Time to max. recorded Delta-V, in longitudinal direction.
Interval between zero time and the maximum value of the cumulative speed change along the X-axis.
Clipping Flag.
Indicates the time at which the acceleration (longitudinal or transverse) is first within the range of the sensor.
Driving speed.

The vehicle speed is reported as the average speed of all wheels. Data accuracy can be influenced by several factors, such as significant deviations in tire size compared to the factory setting as well as wheel blocks or wheel slip.
Service brake, on or off.
To detect if the driver has actuated the brake pedal.
Status, driver's seat belt.
Status of the seat belt buckle switch of the driver.
Accelerator pedal position.
Accelerator pedal position in percent (fully applied equals 100 %).
Engine speed (RPM).
Number of revolutions per minute of the main crankshaft of the engine (RPM).
Switch-on cycle at the time of the event.
Number of power-up cycles in the electromotive throttle controller from the first power-up to the time of the event.
Switch-on cycle for read out.
Number of power-up cycles in the electromotive throttle controller from the first power-up to the time of display.
Completeness status of the event data recorder.
Indicates if the event data was recorded and stored completely.
Interval between this event and the previous event.
When two events occur within 5 seconds, this is the time from the beginning of Event X to the beginning of Event X-1 (this plus the previous event) that has elapsed.
VIN.
Vehicle manufacturer predefined vehicle identification number VIN.
ECU hardware number, ECU serial number, ECU software number.
Unique identification of the hardware, software and serial number of the throttle controller that are used.
Acceleration in transverse direction.
Acceleration in transverse direction (Y-axis).
Delta-V in transverse direction.
Change of the transverse speed of the vehicle. Delta-V in the transverse direction is only the transverse component of the entire delta-V.
Max. recorded Delta-V in transverse direction.
The maximum value of the cumulative change in vehicle speed along the Y-axis as recorded by the electromotive throttle controller.
Square of the maximum recorded resulting Delta-V.
Maximum value of the squares of Delta-V in longitudinal direction and Delta-V in transverse direction.
Time to max. recorded Delta-V in transverse direction.
Interval between zero time and the maximum value of the cumulative speed change along the X-axis.
Time to the square of the maximum recorded resulting Delta-V.
Interval between the time zero and the maximum value of the square of the delta V resultant according to recording or processing by the electromotive throttle controller.
Yaw rate.
Changing the vehicle angle around the Z-axis before and during an event.
Steering angle.
Turning position of the steering wheel (neutral position = zero value/0°; counterclockwise turn/counterclockwise direction = positive value).
Tend.
End of the collision event/time of last recorded data point.
Time stamp of the event.
Time stamp with year, month, day, hour, minute and second.
Gear position.
Current gear position.
Throttle valve position of the engine.
Percentage of the opening of the throttle valve (100 % corresponds to the completely opened position).
Status of automated parking system.
To detect if the hand brake is active.
Status, turn signal.
Activation status of the turn indicator.
Trigger time of the belt-pretensioning system.
For driver and front passenger: time from beginning of the event T0 to the seat belt tensioner trigger command.
Front airbag deployment time, Phase I.
For driver and front passenger: time from beginning of the event T0 to the front airbag deployment command of Phase I.
Positive airbag deployment time, Phase II.
For driver and front passenger: time from beginning of the event T0 to the front airbag deployment command of Phase II.
Side airbag deployment time.
For driver and front passenger: time from beginning of the event T0 to the side airbag deployment command.
Deployment time of the side airbag (side windows).
For driver and front passenger: time from beginning of the event T0 to the deployment time of the side airbag on the driver's side and/or passenger's side.
Status, front passenger seatbelt.
Status of the seat belt buckle switch of the front passenger.
Suppression status, front passenger airbag.
Suppression status of the front airbag of the front passenger.
Warning status of the occupant safety system.
Fault status, occupant safety system.
Warning status of the tire pressure monitoring system.
Warning status when the on-board tire pressure monitoring system has detected that the tire pressure is too low in one or more tires.
Warning status of the brake system.
Fault status of the brake system.
Status of the cruise control system –a).

Status of the Dynamic Cruise Control system. The following statuses are possible: switched on and active, switched on and not activated, switched off, fault. For more information on the Dynamic Cruise Control system, refer to the Owner’s Manual.
Status of the Adaptive Cruise Control system –a).

Status of the Adaptive Cruise Control system. The following statuses are possible: switched on and active, switched on and not activated, switched off, fault. Further information on the Adaptive Cruise Control system can be found in the Owner’s Manual.
Status of the Antilock Braking System.

The active brake system is part of the continuous electronic stability control system (Dynamic Stability Control). The following statuses are possible: active, inactive, fault. Further information on the Dynamic Stability Control system can be found in the Owner’s Manual.
Status of the autonomous emergency brake system (AEB) –a).

The function of the autonomous emergency braking system is implemented by the iBrake system. The following statuses are possible: switched on and active, switched on and not activated, switched off, fault. For more information on the iBrake system, refer to the Owner’s Manual (Warning with braking function section).
Status of the electronic driving stability control system.

Status of the continuous electronic stability control system (Dynamic Stability Control). The following statuses are possible: switched on and active, switched on and not activated, switched off, fault. Further information on the Dynamic Stability Control system can be found in the Owner’s Manual.
Status of the traction control system.

The traction control system (Dynamic Traction Control) is part of the continuous electronic stability control system (Dynamic Stability Control). The following status information is possible: switched on and active, switched on and not activated, switched off, fault (similar to the status of the electronic stability control system). Further information on the Dynamic Stability Control and Dynamic Traction Control system can be found in the Owner’s Manual.
Synchronization time before an event.
Relative time of the last data sampling point before T0 to T0 to enable data synchronization.

a) This data element is only recorded for vehicles equipped with a driver assistance system (ADAS). Further information on functions of the driver assistance system (ADAS) can be found in the Owner’s Manual.

section.paragraph: Note: In order to ensure a detailed accident analysis, the vehicle manufacturer records additional data elements.
Further information is available on the BMW website:
https://www.bmw.com.cn/zh/footer/vehicle-data-collect/overview.html

section.title: Event Data Recorder (EDR)
section.paragraph: This vehicle is equipped with an event data recorder (EDR). The main purpose of an EDR is to record, in certain crash or near crash-like situations, such as an air bag deployment or hitting a road obstacle, data that will assist in understanding how a vehicle’s systems performed. The EDR is designed to record data related to vehicle dynamics and safety systems for a short period of time, typically 30 seconds or less.
The EDR in this vehicle is designed to record such data as:

item.paragraph: How various systems in your vehicle were operating.
Whether or not the driver and passenger seat belts were fastened.
How far, if at all, the driver was depressing the accelerator and/or brake pedal.
How fast the vehicle was traveling.

section.paragraph: This data can help provide a better understanding of the circumstances in which crashes and injuries occur.

EDR data is recorded by your vehicle only if a nontrivial crash situation occurs; no data is recorded by the EDR under normal driving conditions and no personal data, for instance name, gender, age, and crash location, are recorded.
However, other parties, such as law enforcement, could combine the EDR data with the type of personally identifying data routinely acquired during a crash investigation.

To read data recorded by an EDR, special equipment is required, and access to the vehicle or the EDR is needed. In addition to the vehicle manufacturer, other parties, such as law enforcement, that have the special equipment, can read the information if they have access to the vehicle or the EDR.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the national-market equipment, the vehicle identification number is located in different positions in the vehicle. This chapter describes all possible positions for the series.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The engraved vehicle identification number can be found in the engine compartment, on the right-hand side of the vehicle.
The engraved vehicle identification number can be found under the hood on the right-hand side of the vehicle.

section.paragraph: The engraved vehicle identification number can be found under the hood on the right-hand side of the vehicle.
The hood must only be opened by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

warning.paragraph: An incorrectly locked hood can open while driving and restrict visibility. There is a risk of accident. Stop immediately and correctly close the hood.
Body parts can be jammed when opening and closing the hood. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the area of movement of hood is clear during opening and closing.
There are protruding parts, for instance locking hooks, on the inside of the hood. There is a risk of injury. If the hood is open, pay attention to protruding parts and keep clear of these areas.

action-step.paragraph: Remove the wire loop from the opening in the instrument panel.
Pull on the wire loop. Left hood lock is unlocked.
Repeat on the right side of the vehicle.
The hood is unlocked and can be opened.
Open unlocked hood and hold open with your hand.
Two bore holes are located in the hood hinges. Open the hood until the bore holes of the inner and outer hinges lie above one another.
Block the hinges on both sides of the vehicle with a suitable tool. The hood is locked.
Slightly lift the hood and hold.
Release the lock on both sides.
Let the hood fall from a height of approx. 30 cm30 cm, approx. 12 in12 in/30 cm.
The hood must engage on both sides. Push down as necessary.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The vehicle identification number can be found on the nameplate, on the right-hand side of the vehicle.
The vehicle identification number can be found on the nameplate, on the left-hand side of the vehicle.
The vehicle identification number can also be found behind the windshield.

section.title: iDrive
section.paragraph: It is also possible to display the vehicle identification number via iDrive.

paragraph.textref: "MENU"
"All apps"
"Mobile devices"
"Settings"
"Vehicle ID (VIN):"

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The engraved engine identification number is located on the engine block. The vehicle manufacturer recommends that you have the relevant work carried out an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

The engine shown serves as an example for the position of the engine identification number. Depending on the motorization, the exact position of the engine identification number can differ from the illustration shown.

section.title: For US customers
section.paragraph: The following only applies to vehicles owned and operated in the US.

If you believe that your vehicle has a defect which could cause a crash or could cause injury or death, you should immediately inform the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA), in addition to notifying BMW of North America, LLC, P.O. Box 1227, Westwood, New Jersey 07675-1227, Telephone 1-800-831-1117.
If NHTSA receives similar complaints, it may open an investigation, and if it finds that a safety defect exists in a group of vehicles, it may order a recall and remedy campaign.
However, NHTSA cannot become involved in individual problems between you, your dealer, or BMW of North America, LLC.

To contact NHTSA, you may call the Vehicle Safety Hotline toll-free at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY: 1-800-424-9153); go to http://www.safercar.gov; or write to: Administrator, NHTSA, 1200 New Jersey Avenue, SE., Washington, DC 20590. You can also obtain other information about motor vehicle safety from http://www.safercar.gov.

section.title: For Canadian customers
section.paragraph: Canadian customers who wish to report a safety-related defect to Transport Canada, Defect Investigations and Recalls, may call the toll-free hotline 1-800-333-0510. You can also obtain other information about motor vehicle safety from http://www.tc.gc.ca/roadsafety.

section.title: Note on manufacturing defects
section.paragraph: Manufacturer: BMW KOREA Co.
Address: Jung-gu, Toegye-ro, 100, State Tower, 14F, Seoul (postal code: 100-052)
Contact number: 080-269-2200 (BMW Communication Center)

If you are of the opinion that there is a danger of a traffic accident due to frequent malfunctions of the vehicle, please contact BMW KOREA Co. or the Korea Automobile Testing & Research Institute (KATRI) of the Korea Transportation Safety Authority (KTSA) in the interest of your own safety and the safety of others.

The Korea Automobile Testing & Research Institute records and analyzes consumer complaints and, if there is the suspicion of a manufacturing defect, performs examinations that may lead to recalls by the manufacturer.
Complaints department and customer service of the Korea Automobile Testing & Research Institute (KATRI):
Korea Automobile Testing & Research Institute (KATRI) Tel.: 080-357-2500
Website: information network for manufacturing defects (www.vehicle.go.kr)
